TopicTitle: Toggle Asteroid Visibility in Mission Map

Articles.Content:
I am trying to stage a mission to Jool, but in the mission map, I can't figure out how to turn off the asteroid visibility. As a result, I have a bunch of white orbits clogging up my mission map. How do I turn off asteroid visibility?

Just to further clarify, this is not a question of how to turn off asteroids at the tracking station/observatory on Kerbin. This is a question about the map you pull up during a mission. Thanks!

It works similarly to how tracking station works. Move your mouse at the top of the game screen/window and a line of buttons will drop down, allowing you to select what you want and what you don't want to see.

This is a real pro tip. I never found that by "accident", so now I had a mission (I could not go back to Space Center because I wanted to retain the "Revert") and your Post saved me. Thanks, Carsten PS: Another pro tip I really like: The test component button which works outside the Staging

In the map screen, you have the top bar with lots of icons on it. To toggle individual object classes (in your case, asteroids), left-click on the respective icon (it's in the far right if memory serves).
If you turn off Asteroids in Tracking station (right-click), they will be turned off in the mission map.

This is a real pro tip. I never found that by "accident", so now I had a mission (I could not go back to Space Center because I wanted to retain the "Revert") ...
